intro.speaker: Radd
intro.line: We did it, Caesar! Our ambush was a success. They're completely surrounded. Tactical victory is ours.

intro.speaker: Caesar
intro.line: I see. However, don't lower your guard. Our enemy is the Altean army... We know how strong they are.

intro.speaker: Radd
intro.line: But Caesar, are you really fine with this? We did fight under Altea's banner in the previous war...

intro.speaker: Caesar
intro.line: We're mercenaries. We have no liege. I need gold, and will do anything for it. Even selling my soul to the devil.

intro.speaker: Radd
intro.line: Gold, huh... Indeed, when we get the reward from Emperor Hardin... I'm sure we could save her. Alright, let's do it, Caesar!

intro.speaker: Caesar
intro.line: Radd, there's no need for you to follow me. My sister is my business. The Altean army is strong. You'll die if you're careless.

intro.speaker: Radd
intro.line: I'm doing this for my own interests too. So I'll tag along with you, Caesar. As I always have, and always will.

intro.speaker: Legion
intro.line: Yes, yes, yesss! It's finally time for us allses! Uwee hee hee!!! Togethers with those mercenaries, we'll gives Marth a royal funeral!

intro.speaker: Clarisse
intro.line: It seems some of those mercenaries were Marth's allies in the previous war. I do wonder if they'll be of any use.

intro.speaker: Legion
intro.line: So whats? Doesn't matters. If they're uselesses, all we have to do is kills him ourselves.

intro.speaker: Clarisse
intro.line: Bah, I don't like you getting the best part. Oh well, do whatever you want.

recruit-battle.speaker: Caesar
recruit-battle.line: The time for words is gone. Fighting is all we can do, now.

recruit-battle.speaker: Caesar
recruit-battle.line: Can't I... even save... one little sister...?

recruit-battle.speaker: Radd
recruit-battle.line: I am Radd, deputy commander of this mercenary band. Here I come...

boss.speaker: Legion
boss.line: Uwee hee hee! Come on! Come on! Come on! Timeses to fight!!!

boss.speaker: Legion
boss.line: We won't dies... even if you kill mes... Uwee...hee...

end.speaker: Caesar
end.line: You win, Prince Marth. I should have known you weren't a foe we could defeat with petty tricks. I surrender. Kill me or whatever; I'm all yours.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Caesar, I'd like to hire you and Radd if possible. I want you to come with us. You and Radd fought by my side in the previous war. You're both my comrades.

end.speaker: Caesar
end.line: Prince, forgive me, but we're mercenaries. All we did in the previous war was fulfill our duties as hired swords.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: It might have been just a job for you two... But not to me. Both of you are my precious comrades. You were then, and still are now.

end.speaker: Caesar
end.line: Prince... I appreciate your willingness to say such kind words to mercenaries like us. However, at the end of the day, we're hired swords. Therefore, we ask for gold. Prince, Archanea occupies your country. It's obvious you don't have the extra resources needed to pay us.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Well, you have a point...

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Gold shouldn't be an issue. Prince Marth will reclaim Altea, our homeland. Altea may be occupied by Archanea now, but we shall defeat them. And then, you'll have the gold you seek.

end.speaker: Caesar
end.line: Do you... honestly think you stand a chance? Against a powerful kingdom like Archanea?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Of course. Besides, I'm sure you don't have a choice, at this point. Since you've failed your mission, Archanea won't pay you the gold you seek anymore. If you're a hired sword working for gold, following Prince Marth would serve your interests better. Am I wrong?

end.speaker: Caesar
end.line: ...Indeed, your argument is sound. As we've failed, we have no other options. Prince Marth, Radd and I are now your hired swords. We shall accompany you for as long as you wish us to.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Thank you, Caesar.

end.speaker: Radd
end.line: No... Caesar...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Radd... You have my condolences. Radd, I'd like to hire you if possible. I want you to come with us. You and Caesar fought by our side in the previous war. You're both my comrades.

end.speaker: Radd
end.line: ...Me, work for you? Sure thing, Prince Marth. But I hate you guys. I could just feign joining you, Prince, and then try and kill you, y'know?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I don't mind.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Sire...!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Radd, listen to me. Caesar is dead... We killed him. And that's why I ask this of you. I don't want this... I don't want comrades killing each other!

end.speaker: Radd
end.line: ...Prince Marth...

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Radd. This is the first time we meet. I don't know your connection with Caesar. However, I know this. Caesar's death... pains Prince Marth as much as it pains you...

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Radd, Prince Marth will be even sadder if you die, too. We don't want to repeat that tragedy again. So, please...

end.speaker: Radd
end.line: ...Alright. Prince Marth, if you so wish, then I'll tag along with you. I'll accept the money once this war is over. For Caesar's sake, too, I must save that girl...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Thank you, Radd.

end.speaker: Caesar
end.line: We lose, Prince Marth. I should have known you weren't a foe we could defeat with petty tricks. Kill me. Send me to where Radd is waiting.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Caesar, I'd like to hire you, if possible. I want you to come with us. You and Radd fought by my side in the previous war. You're both my comrades.

end.speaker: Caesar
end.line: Prince, forgive me, but we're mercenaries. All we did in the previous war was fulfill our duties as hired swords. Besides, do you think I'd just agree? Now that Radd's been killed...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: That's right, Radd is dead... We killed him. But that's exactly why I'm asking this of you. I don't want this... I don't want comrades killing each other anymore!

end.speaker: Caesar
end.line: ...Prince Marth...

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Mercenary commander Caesar. This is the first time we meet. I don't know your connection with Radd. However, I know this. Radd's death... pains Prince Marth as much as it pains you...

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Caesar, Prince Marth will be even sadder if you die, too. We don't want to repeat that tragedy again. So, please...

end.speaker: Caesar
end.line: ...Very well. While I'm not fully convinced... This was something I brought upon myself. I have no right to blame others for it. Prince Marth, from now on I'm in your service. I shall accompany you for as long as you wish it.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Thank you, Caesar.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Sire, the battle is over.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Kris, Caesar and Radd were... our comrades in the previous war. Jeorge too, to think we'd be fighting our former comrades like this...

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Sire, you must be strong. Now that Archanea has become our enemy, we'll have to face this kind of situation many times over. But don't worry, sire. You will always have Kris and me--your loyal retainers--by your side.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Thank you, Jagen, Kris. It's only because you're with me that I can walk forward. Let us go, to the Fane of Raman.

end.speaker: Clarisse
end.line: Oh dear. Legion, it seems your clone died.

end.speaker: Legion
end.line: Legion was no clone. Legion was our brotherses. We are allses brotherses.

end.speaker: Clarisse
end.line: Ugh, whatever. So, are you the real Legion? Or just another clone?

end.speaker: Legion
end.line: Who knows? Legion doesn't knowses. Uwee hee hee! The Alteans are strong-strong. Next times, we'll bring ALL our brotherses. Real Legion and brotherses, together we'll kills Marth. Uwee hee!
